meaningMnemonic:
This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>concave</kanji>, but "to concave" doesn't really make sense. So the verb version is <vocabulary>to get dented</vocabulary>. Or, more figuratively, <vocabulary>to feel down</vocabulary>.

凹む is used in a physical sense when the surface of something is dented, collapsed inward, or features some kind of hollow depression. That can be anything from a dented car to even a fit, slimmed-down belly (sort of like the flab is "dented" in).

In a figurative sense, 凹む is used when you're feeling down. Almost like your heart is dented, you know? We all have those days.
